name: Slim Thug
description:
'''Stayve Jerome Thomas''' (born September 8, 1980) better known by his stage name '''Slim Thug''', is an American rapper. He gained mainstream attention for his guest performance alongside [[Paul Wall]] on [[Mike Jones (rapper)|Mike Jones]]' 2004 single "[[Still Tippin']]". The following year, he guest appeared alongside [[Bun B]] on [[Beyoncé]]'s 2005 single "[[Check on It]]"—which peaked atop the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] and won an [[MTV Video Music Award for Best R&B Video|MTV Music Video Award]]—and signed with [[Interscope Geffen A&M]] and [[the Neptunes]]' [[Star Trak Entertainment]] to release his debut studio album ''[[Already Platinum]]'' (2005). It peaked at number two on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and was followed by his second album, ''[[Boss of All Bosses]]'' (2009), which peaked at number 15 as an [[independent music|independent]] release.

Furthermore, Thomas guest appeared on [[Gwen Stefani]]'s 2005 single "[[Luxurious (song)|Luxurious]]", which peaked at number 21 on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100.
